Risk Controls Review - Risk Register
Details
Risk Register Reviewed
Rev. No
Issue Date
Wilson Business Unit Reviewed
Suspended Load
All operators must be fully trained and competent to operate with suspended loads
All written procedures must be safely followed at all times when working with suspended load
All other personnel stay clear from suspended load at all times
Inspections and pre-starts to be conducted on plant/machinery at every time prior to use.
All lifting gear to be inspected and certified safe
Where practicable, permanent exclusion zones to be established to avoid unauthorised access
Working at Height
Avoid work at height where possible
A certified scaffolding shall be used when practicable. Any modifications shall be undertaken only by certified and competent scaffolding company
Regular inspections of scaffolding shall be undertaken by certified scaffolding company
When required, harness and lanyard shall be worn while working on scaffolding
Use a safe working platform with handrails where possible (access ladder platform)
Where a safe working platform cannot be used, use equipment which will restrain or arrest falls (safety harnesses)
All personnel working at heights must be fully trained and competent.
All written procedures must be safely followed at all times when conducting works at heights – including approved rescue plan(s)
A rescue plan shall be completed and rolled out prior to working at heights
Exclusion zones must be designated where works at heights are conducted
All working at heights safety gear to be inspected and certified safe
Inspections and pre-starts to be conducted on all working at heights safety gear at every time prior to use
Working at heights permit to be filled and accepted prior to use
Plant & Machinery
All operators using plant/machinery must hold valid license/certificate and be fully trained/competent to operate the plant/machinery
All written procedures must be safely followed at all times when conducting works with plant/machinery
Site speed limit max of 10 km/hr at all times
Inspections and pre-starts to be conducted on plant/machinery at every time prior to use
All other personnel stay clear from moving plant/machinery at all times
Designated walkways/pathways to be used by all personnel at all times
All Plant/Machinery to be inspected and certified for safe operation
All safety features such as safety guards, covers, E-stops etc. to be permanently installed and fully functional at all times.
Only fully trained and competent operator shall work and operate with reinforcing processing machinery
Only trained and competent personnel shall conduct maintenance of reinforcing processing machinery
Lock-out, tag-out (LO-TO) process shall apply when machinery maintenance is in progress
Confined Space
Assess the task to verify if it is possible to undertake the works outside the confined space
Only competent personnel with appropriate training shall work in confined space
A spotter outside of confines space shall be used in case of emergency
Lock out/Tag out (LO-TO) process shall apply prior to working in confined space (i.e. plant/machinery isolation)
Ventilate the confined space as much as practicable
Adequate respiratory protection shall be worn to avoid any dust, gases, airborne contaminants inhalation
Permit shall be approved and issued prior to working in confined space
Compressed Air
Only competent personnel with appropriate training shall work with compressed air
Regular inspection and maintenance of the equipment. Pressure gauges shall be regularly serviced and calibrated
NEVER use compressed air on body or naked skin (to avoid air entering the bloodstream)
Pre & post tensioning strand
All operators conducting stressing process must be fully trained and competent to prior to proceeding with the task
Inspections and pre-starts to be conducted on stressing equipment at every time prior to use
All written procedures must be safely followed at all times when pre & post tensioning strands
All other personnel must stay clear from pre-stressed areas/zones at all times
Poor Housekeeping
Keep the area as clear & clean as possible to avoid a trip hazard.
Tools and equipment are to be returned to the store or personal tool box after use
Any waste is to be removed from working area as soon as practicable
All amenities are to be kept in a clean and hygienic condition
All waste is to be placed in the appropriate waste bin
Walkways, scaffolds, stairways and other work areas are to be free of obstruction and sharp objects
All steel manufacturing machineries to be kept clean and tidy at all times
All materials (i.e. Inward goods, steel / strand coils, precast elements, reo bars / cages, etc.) to be stored in designated areas only and as per correct stacking procedures
Power tools use
All operators using tools & equipment must be fully trained and competent to prior to proceeding the tasks
Inspections and pre-starts to be conducted on all powered tools/equipment at every time prior to use
All written procedures to be safely followed at all times when using tool/equipment
All personnel to wear mandatory PPE at all times.
All operators are obligated to wear specific personal protective equipment (PPE) as per written procedure
All safety guards must be installed at all times when using tool/equipment
Damaged or unsafe tools shall not be used for any operation
Hot work permit (for specific equipment) to be filled and accepted prior to use
Manual working/handling
All written procedures must be safely followed at all times when manually working/handling
All personnel to wear mandatory PPE at all time
All personnel stay in their designated zone while working
All personnel must be trained and competent for any tasks prior to conducting it
Maximum weight to be lifted by one person is 25 Kg
Hand protection shall be worn at all times while working / handling with reinforcement coils / bars / cages
Dangerous/Hazardous goods
All personnel using dangerous/hazardous goods must be trained and competent prior to working with them
All personnel to wear mandatory PPE at all time
All users are obligated to wear specific personal protective equipment (PPE) as per written instruction in SDS
All dangerous/hazardous goods must be stacked and stored as per written instruction in SDS
All materials are used as per written instruction in TDS/SDS
Material SDS must be available where the materials are stored
Spill kit to be available in area/zone where dangerous/hazardous goods are used
All hazardous substances shall be stored in their original containers
NO hazardous substances shall be stored in unlabeled or incorrectly labelled containers
Environmental Stressors
All personnel to wear mandatory PPE at all time
Apply min SPF30+ sun cream regularly to protect your skin if working under the Sun
Drink enough water to avoid dehydration
Take regular breaks as required
Adequate lighting for night work is to be provided when light is poor
Hand protection shall be worn at all times while working / handling with reinforcement coils / bars / cages
Adequate ventilation to be provided in all indoor areas
Adequate respiratory protection shall be worn at all times in areas where steel / silica dust is presented / created
All hot water piping system shall be insulated and protected to avoid contact with personnel
Boiler and all pressure gauges shall be regularly inspected and calibrated
All written procedures must be safely followed at all times when working with hot water/steam
Environmental
Spill kits to be available and clearly identified in case of chemical spills
Treatment and disposal of storm water and ‘Wash-Down’ water
Catchpits protected with geotextile cloth for treating storm water
Recycling of wash down water
Water recycle system and water reuse for batch plant
Dust control to be maintained by using specific equipment and used only in designated areas
Sealed driveways to be swept and unsealed areas to be watered (if necessary, in dry and windy days)
Limited traffic speed limit on site of 10 km/hr at all times
Waste to be disposed on regular basis
Disposal of chemicals as per manufacturers recommendation
WG-04-CH-01 – Site Safety Inspection HS Rep
Prompting Name: WG-04-CH-01 – Site Safety Inspection HS Rep

Name: Guidelines
1. Are all entrances and exits free from obstructions? (add photos)
2. Are stairs and walkways clear of equipment, cables and other obstacles? (add photos)
3. Is stored material secured to prevent shifting / falling? Are stacking process instructions / TR displayed?
4. Are precast units stored as per company standards and requirements? Are stacking process instructions / TR displayed?
5. Are there any issues with installed lighting and ventilation in the work area? If yes, explain the issue and add photos.
6. Are machinery / plant / equipment prestarts checks regularly completed and documented? (Random check and add photos)
7. Are the appropriate work permits completed and issued? Is there a designated area for these works? (add photos)
8. Are there any maintenance works being undertaken? If yes, please list the works (add photos)
9. Are hazardous substances and containers properly labelled? (add photos)
10. Are hazardous substances properly stored? (add photos of the DG store)
11. Are Safety Data Sheets available for all chemicals? (add photos of the book / folder)
12. Are all cords, plugs and sockets in good conditions? (not frayed, exposed, cracked) – (add photos)
13. Have fire extinguishers been inspected and certified in the last 12 months? (add photos)
14. Are emergency exits clearly marked, easy to open and functional? (add photos)
15. Provide the names of current first aid responders present in the area you are inspecting.
16. Are the first aid kits maintained and stocked? (random check with photos of contents)
17. Are the staff toilets, bathroom facilities and the kitchen area in good clean condition? (add photos)
18. Is the correct mandatory PPE worn by workers and subcontractors? (add photos)
If any of the items above do NOT COMPLY, please state your observation and required action.
Inspector’s Observations / Recommendations
Mgmt. Comments (i.e. responsibility, due dates)
Environmental Inspection
1. Is visible dust being generated by site work activities? If yes, explain how.
2. Is there any cross contamination happening in specific recycling skips? (timber / steel / concrete) (add photos)
3. Is all metal scrap contained within the correct bins with no overflow creating a hazard / danger? (add photos)
4. Are there any visible spills or leaks in the area you are inspecting? If yes, note details and add photos
5. Are there any catch pits missing filter cloths? (add photos)
6. How much rubbish / debris is lying around the area you are inspecting? (add photos)

Workers keeping a safe distance from machinery.

Hazard board and signage are up to date.

Escape routes are suitable, safe and clearly identified (no obstacles)
Protective caps fitted to reinforcing steel.
Operators properly trained for appropriate tasks and hold current licence if operating a machine.

Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
Correct mandatory PPE worn at all times
Specialized PPE for specific hazards and tasks are utilized correctly
Emergency Equipment
Fire fighting equipment (extinguisher) is available, clearly marked and hold current certification.
First aid equipment is available, clearly marked and fully stocked.
Chemical Materials Storage
Materials stored in a safe and approved manner (unlabelled containers with chemicals not observed)
Everything well stacked and free from trip hazards
Safety Data Sheets (SDS) are available
Material types are segregated as required.
Spill kits are available, clearly marked and fully stocked.
Chemical materials Storage clearly identified and 'No smoking' signs in place.
Workplace Cleanliness / Housekeeping
Rubbish and scrap material is removed and located into appropriate bins.
Spare materials are removed from work areas and stored (lifters, cast-ins, wood, dunnage, miscellaneous cut pieces, scrap)
Bins are not overfilled and effective recycling is evident.
No trip hazards are present.
Storage areas are clearly define.
Plant and Machinery
Operator's communication is appropriate and effective (Crane operators / Drivers)
Prestart checks regularly completed and documented.
Rigging equipment are tested and hold current tag (random check)
Appropriate rigging equipment is utilized for the work task.
Spotters are utilized as appropriate.
Permit System (i.e. Working at Heights, Hot Works)
Appropriate work permits are utilized by the work group as required by permit system.
Permit properly identifies the work to be performed and has been approved by a Competent Person.
Appropriate workers are signed on to the permit.
Working at heights
Prestart checks of safety items (harness, lanyard) is completed and documented
Safety items are tested and hold current tag (random check)
Ladders prestart checks regularly completed and documented.
Ladders are in good condition and safely stored (random check)
Rescue plan is displayed in the area.
Tools and Equipment
Tools and equipment are in good serviceable condition (random check)
RCD power outlets hold current testing tag (random check)
Welding equipment and gas bottles are secured, correctly set-up and safe to use.
El. leads are secured and stored effectively to avoid trip hazards.
El. tools, equipment and leads are not used in wet condition.
No 'home made' hand tools are present.
Environmental
No excessive dust being generated on site neither noted beyond the site boundary.
No visible spill, which could contaminate water discharging from site.
Site surroundings are tidy, not visible accumulated rubbish.
No vehicle is leaving the site with concrete caked on the tyres (random check)
Swales are well vegetated with no rubbish accumulated.
Catch pits are protected using filter cloth (random check)
No signs of weeds starting to grow on the site that need removal.
No unusual high noise-generating activities being observed.

Name: Site Management
Is Environmental Management Plan (EMP) in place, kept on site at all times?
Is EMP reviewed annually and is upto date?
Are all processes on site operated and managing in accordance with EMP?
Atmospheric Emissions
Is visible dust being generated by site work activities,stockpiles, disturbed areas or site roads?
Any visible emissions were noted beyond the site boundary?
Are road exits and all paved areas of the site regularly inspected and maintained by Sweeper to avoid accumulation of dust?
Any dust or odour caused by discharges are noted beyond the site boundary?
Any air quality (e.g. dust, odour) complaints received since last inspection?
Erosion and Sediment Control
Is there any evidence of uncontrolled dirty water discharge from the site?
Is there any visible discolouration of waters leaving the site?
Is there any sediment built up along curb lines? (If yes, picture required)
Waste Management and Spills
All waste is stored within designated area?
All waste bins are covered? (picture required)
Has stored waste reached levels requiring removal from site?
Is waste only removed by licensed Contractors?
Are recycling bins adequate and being used on site?
Is all metal scrap covered and protect from danger of becoming a source of contaminants?
Have any spills of oils, fuel or hazardous substances occurred onsite, since last inspection?
Land Use
Site surrounds are tidy and rubbish removed?
Are road exit points free from dirt/debris?
Are parking spaces clear of containers, pallets or any storage items?
Are signage of limited speed (10km/hr) within the site boundaries in place?
Are pedestrian linkages and access driveways within parking areas provided with lighting?
Any vehicle is leaving the site with concrete caked on the tyres?
STORMWATER OPERATION & MAINTENANCE
Swales
Are all swales well vegetated? (pic required)
Does any swale needs a maintenance?
Are outflows from downpipes clear?
Is Outlet structure from swale in good condition?
Stormwater 360 filter system checked?
(picture required)
Is a slot drain in good condition and regularly cleaned?
All catch pits are protected using filter cloth?
(picture required)
Any evidence of adverse weather conditions (e.g. critical storm) overloading system?
FLORA, FAUNA, PESTS & NOXIOUS WEEDS MANAGEMENT
Are there noxious or environmental weeds on the work site still needing to be controlled?
Are there signs of revegetation or re-grassing not taking successfully?
Are there signs of weeds beginning to grow on site?
NOISE AND VIBRATION
Are any unusually high noise-generating activities being undertaken?
Are there any new noise intensive works that require start up monitoring?
Is noise likely to impact on nearby residents?
Are vibration-generating activities being carried out likely to affect nearby structures or residents?
Are there any new vibration intensive works that require start up monitoring?
HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES
Has any contamination been uncovered on the site?
Has any hazardous waste been generated on the site?
Is Hazardous storage area well marked by signage?
Are MSDS sheets available and upto date?
Are required Emergency Spill Kits in place and ready for use?
Are required Fire extinguishers in place and ready for use?
